description: Provides rich language support for CSS, LESS and SCSS files.

css.completion.completePropertyWithSemic.description: Insert semicolon at end of line when completing CSS properties.

css.completion.triggerPropertyValueCompl.description: By default, VS Code triggers property value completion after selecting a CSS property. Use this setting to disable this behavior.

css.customData.markdownDescription:
A list of relative file paths pointing to JSON files following the [custom data format](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-css-languageservice/blob/master/docs/customData.md).

VS Code loads custom data on startup to enhance its CSS support for CSS custom properties (variables), at-rules, pseudo-classes, and pseudo-elements you specify in the JSON files.

The file paths are relative to workspace and only workspace folder settings are considered.

css.format.braceStyle.markdownDescription: Put braces on the same line as rules (`collapse`) or put braces on own line (`expand`).

css.format.maxPreserveNewLines.markdownDescription: Maximum number of line breaks to be preserved in one chunk, when `#css.format.preserveNewLines#` is enabled.

css.format.newlineBetweenRules.markdownDescription: Separate rulesets by a blank line.

css.format.newlineBetweenSelectors.markdownDescription: Separate selectors with a new line.

css.format.preserveNewLines.markdownDescription: Whether existing line breaks before elements should be preserved.

css.format.spaceAroundSelectorSeparator.markdownDescription: Ensure a space character around selector separators '>', '+', '~' (e.g. `a > b`).

css.hover.documentation.description: Show property and value documentation in CSS hovers.

css.hover.references.description: Show references to MDN in CSS hovers.

css.lint.boxModel.markdownDescription: Do not use `width` or `height` when using `padding` or `border`.

css.lint.compatibleVendorPrefixes.description: When using a vendor-specific prefix make sure to also include all other vendor-specific properties.

css.lint.duplicateProperties.description: Do not use duplicate style definitions.

css.lint.float.markdownDescription: Avoid using `float`. Floats lead to fragile CSS that is easy to break if one aspect of the layout changes.

css.lint.hexColorLength.description: Hex colors must consist of 3, 4, 6 or 8 hex numbers.

css.lint.idSelector.description: Selectors should not contain IDs because these rules are too tightly coupled with the HTML.

css.lint.ieHack.description: IE hacks are only necessary when supporting IE7 and older.

css.lint.importStatement.description: Import statements do not load in parallel.

css.lint.important.markdownDescription: Avoid using `!important`. It is an indication that the specificity of the entire CSS has gotten out of control and needs to be refactored.

css.lint.propertyIgnoredDueToDisplay.markdownDescription: Property is ignored due to the display. E.g. with `display: inline`, the `width`, `height`, `margin-top`, `margin-bottom`, and `float` properties have no effect.

css.lint.universalSelector.markdownDescription: The universal selector (`*`) is known to be slow.

css.lint.validProperties.description: A list of properties that are not validated against the `unknownProperties` rule.

css.lint.vendorPrefix.description: When using a vendor-specific prefix, also include the standard property.

css.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the CSS language server.
